snippet.title: Amazon adds NBC shows like 'Grimm' to streaming catalog
snippet.description: "Suits" and "Covert Affairs" from USA Network are also available, while NBC's "Hannibal" and Syfy's "Defiance" will be come at a later date.

snippet.title: No joke: Comedy Central app launches with 200 episodes
snippet.description: Appropriately timed for April Fools' Day, Comedy Central's new app replaces show-specific apps, creating a one-stop spot with free full episodes of "The Daily Show," "South Park," and more.

snippet.title: Channel 4 yanks full episodes from YouTube, says go to 4oD
snippet.description: Channel 4 has pulled all its full-length episodes of its TV shows from YouTube. If you want to watch shows like Fresh Meat in their entirety, you'll have to head to 4oD to do so.

snippet.title: Hulu makes some mobile video free, but no full episodes
snippet.description: Following its announcement of a new CEO, Hulu shifts to let anyone watch clips on its mobile site, after previously making mobile video off limits to all but paying subscribers.

snippet.title: Classic 'Star Trek' episodes get retro poster treatment
snippet.description: Artist Juan Ortiz has created amazing 1960s-style posters for every episode of the original series.

snippet.title: Netflix to stream 'The Killing' episodes a day after they air
snippet.description: Season 3 episodes will pop up on Netflix the morning after they air on AMC Sunday nights, but only in the U.K. and Ireland.

snippet.title: 'Arrested Development' trailer peeks at new Netflix episodes
snippet.description: The 90-second trailer catches up with the Bluth family seven years after we last saw them. Netflix will stream all 15 new episodes starting May 26.

snippet.title: Next Netflix binge? All 'Breaking Bad' episodes before the final 8
snippet.description: U.S. subscribers to Netflix can start priming themselves for the final eight episodes of the hit show, as Netflix adds the first half of the fifth season to its library Friday, rounding out the full catalog.

snippet.title: Hulu likely to lose next-day episodes after sale, Eisner says
snippet.description: The former head of Disney, one of Hulu's parents selling the streaming-video site, tells Bloomberg that whoever buys it is likely to follow a Netflix route rather than stream TV repeats right after they air.

snippet.title: A&E brings full-length episodes to iPhone -- for free
snippet.description: As with the iPad version, full episodes of some of the network's top shows are available to stream to the iPhone.
